name: The Town House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A beautiful hotel. From check in to check out the staff were wonderful. We stayed in Room 4, lovely, complete with a small balcony to catch the sun . The roof top terrace is perfect, a late night drink to end the fab days we spent there.
reviews.title: A perfect little oasis in the heart of Marbella Old Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Breakfast was continental and delicious, we didn't get up to the Rooftop as suggested for breakfast, it was far to hot.
reviews.title: Beautiful and boutique...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately I had a days illness while there, they couldn't do enough for either my husband or myself. We will be back!
reviews.title: Special...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for four nights at the beginning of August with my best friend (with whom I shared a room - Room 5) and my little sister (who had her own room - Room 3).
reviews.title: A hidden jewel in the crown of Marbella

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We all loved the atmosphere of this hotel - definitely not just somewhere to sleep, more somewhere you really 'stay'. The overall ambience is luxury, but not at all snooty.
reviews.title: Wish we could have stayed longer...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very convenient for restaurants, shops and the beach in Marbella. As this is a pedestrianised area you need to bring your luggage from the main road to the hotel - 50 metres or less. The plus side of this is that there is minimum street/traffic noise. The hotel itself is clean and housed in a charming building. It appeared to be run by a Swedish management team who were very professional and welcoming. The place had a very relaxed feel yet everything was very organised.
reviews.title: Unique and Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the top floor (3rd floor Room 9) with a very low sloping ceiling on one side. The small private roof terrace attached to the room made up for the slightly cramped feeling in the room. The room was very clean, in fact some days the smell of bleach was over-powering. The shower had good water pressure but could only be used if it was hand held as the bracket would not hold the showerhead properly.
reviews.title: Amazing Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The open central core of the hotel, marble stairway and floors mean that sound does travel as people go in and out of their rooms and when using the communal roof terrace. However we were not disturbed after midnight. In this regard I would say that your good night's sleep could depend on who else is staying in the hotel and how considerate they are.
reviews.title: thank you for an amazing time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: Breakfast was simple and good. Fresh bread, juice, cereals, a few fruits, ham, cheese, tomato, nice coffee. It started a little late for us at 9am and unfortunately another guest staying at the same time seemed to eat everything on show on the dot of 9am and if the staff were not quick, we arrived to empty platters on 3 mornings of our 5 night stay! They did replenish everything, as soon as they could. We felt that the space in the lobby to eat breakfast was not big enough to accommodate everyone. We took our breakfast to our room as we had the terrace space.
reviews.title: Would definitely recommend the Town House...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel lists their recommended restarants on their own printed map. We found many other very good restaurants in the vicinity, particularly off the tourist track and in surrounding commercial streets. Some were much better value and good food - you can see which ones to try by the many locals eating there.
reviews.title: Just right!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful hotel. Very warm welcome, incredibly comfortable beds, and spotlessly clean rooms. Fantastic location, the roof top terrace with its honesty bar was such a perfect touch, and really made the stay.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Thank God for the Town House. After a hellish experience at the PYR in Puerto Banus, we happily headed over to old town Marbella. Thankfully, our Fodor's guide listed the Town House and we were able to get a room on the spot.
reviews.title: DELIGHTFUL!! STAY HERE!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted by the manager of the hotel and she came out to our cab to help us with our things. Sensing our mood from our tortured night in Puerto Banus, we were immediately offered wine and cold water as well as well as a selection of rooms.
reviews.title: Everything is amazing...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is immaculate and white with a fantastic roof terrace - perfect for relaxing with a book and a bottle of wine. Our room was beautiful, spacious and charming. We had a large bathroom, flat screen tv, a/c and a juliet balcony that allowed for fantastic sea breezes.
reviews.title: Very Nice Budget Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in the heart of the old village of Marbella which is truly the best section of the city. If you are in the mood to head to the beach, it is literally only one block away.
reviews.title: Great location, great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights in July 2011.
reviews.title: Not perfect but a very good stay overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: Excellent. Right in Old Town. Surrounded by shops/restaurants. Only a 10 minute walk to the beach/promenade (beach has loungers with umbrellas to rent for only 5 euros).
reviews.title: A Welcome Return Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: Room: Very clean. Antique style furnishings. Had TV, wardrobe, A/C. The showerhead was broken when we arrived and they promptly had it fixed the next morning. The A/C was weak (would not stay cool after about an hour or so) so the nights would get uncomfortably warm a few hours into our sleep.The wardrobe had a giant crack in the mirror - you could argue this added character but I saw it as lack of upkeep.
reviews.title: Excellent little hotel in the Old Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Breakfast: Great. Fresh bread and cold cuts as well as cereals/fruit/beverages.
reviews.title: Very convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service: Excellent. Gave us a good restaurant recommendation (seafood place around the corner). The welcome drink was a great touch. Always willing to help.
reviews.title: A hidden gem

description: The Town House is a private intimate hostel with a central location in the old town, Marbella, in the antique area, close to Plaza de los Naranjos (the orange square). The Town House is almost like a private town house, with four floors, roof terrace and a welcoming indoor and outdoor bar/cafe at the entrance level. All nine rooms are individually decorated, with a tasteful mixture of antiques and modern design.
